member.name: F:SoftLogik.Win.UI.TabSchemeProvider.extendees
member.summary: Hashtable to store the controls that use our extender property.

member.name: F:SoftLogik.Win.UI.TabSchemeProvider.topLevelForm
member.summary: The form we're hosted on, which will be calculated by watching the extendees entering the control hierarchy.

member.name: M:SoftLogik.Win.UI.TabSchemeProvider.GetTabScheme(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Get whether or not we're managing a given control.

member.name: M:SoftLogik.Win.UI.TabSchemeProvider.HookFormLoad
member.summary: Hook up to the form load event and indicate that we've done so.

member.name: M:SoftLogik.Win.UI.TabSchemeProvider.UnhookFormLoad
member.summary: Unhook from the form load event and indicate that we need to do so again before applying tab schemes.

member.name: M:SoftLogik.Win.UI.TabSchemeProvider.HookParentChangedEvents(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Hook up to all of the parent changed events for this control and its ancestors so that we are informed if and when they are added to the top-level form (whose load event we need). It's not adequate to look at just the control, because it may have been added to its parent, but the parent may not be descendent of the form -yet-.

member.name: M:SoftLogik.Win.UI.TabSchemeProvider.SetTabScheme(System.Windows.Forms.Control,SoftLogik.Win.UI.SPTabOrderManager.TabScheme)
member.summary: Set the tab scheme to use on a given control

member.name: M:SoftLogik.Win.UI.TabSchemeProvider.Extendee_ParentChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: We track when each extendee's parent is changed, and also when their parents are changed, until SOMEBODY finally changes their parent to the form, at which point we can hook the load to apply the tab schemes.

member.name: T:SoftLogik.Win.UI.TabSchemeProvider
member.summary: Wrap the TabOrderManager class and supply extendee controls with a custom tab scheme.

member.summary: The tab index we start numbering from when the tab order is applied.

member.summary: The general tab-ordering strategy (i.e. whether we tab across rows first, or down columns).

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The container whose tab order we manage.

member.name: M:SoftLogik.Win.UI.SPTabOrderManager.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Int32,System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Construct a tab order manager that starts numbering at the given tab index.
member.param: The container whose tab order we manage.
List of controls with explicitly defined schemes.

member.name: M:SoftLogik.Win.UI.SPTabOrderManager.SetSchemeForControl(System.Windows.Forms.Control,SoftLogik.Win.UI.SPTabOrderManager.TabScheme)
member.summary: Explicitly set a tab order scheme for a given (presumably container) control.
member.param: The control to set the scheme for.

member.summary: Recursively set the tab order on this container and all of its children.
member.param: The tab ordering strategy to apply.
member.returns: The next tab index to be used.

member.summary: Dynamically determine and set a tab order for a container and children according to a given strategy.
